channel.title: Recent & Upcoming Talks on Jayden Macklin-Cordes
channel.description: Recent content in Recent & Upcoming Talks on Jayden Macklin-Cordes

item.title: CoEDL Summer School 2018
item.description: In November, I’ll be attending CoEDL’s Summer School for 2018. I believe I’ll be giving a short presentation in the course Visualizing Language Data for Analysis and Communication (Lydia Byrne) on my strategies for visualising phylogenetic signal in phonotactic characters. I’m also greatly looking forward to the course Machines can do the work, can’t they? Machine Learning for linguists by Daan van Esch and guests.

item.title: Phylogeny in phonotactics: A multivariate approach for stronger historical signal
item.description: Figure 1 $Kmult$ for biphone transition frequency dataset. Observed $Kmult$ is indicated by the arrow. $Kmult$ for random permutations of the dataset are plotted as a histogram. Figure 2 $Kmult$ for sound class transition frequency dataset. References Adams, Dean C. 2014. “A Generalized K Statistic for Estimating Phylogenetic Signal from Shape and Other High-Dimensional Multivariate Data.” Systematic Biology 63 (5): 685–97. doi:10.
